```{r}
# Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(42)

# Number of observations
n <- 50

# Case 1: Narrow spread of X
X_narrow <- seq(5, 6, length.out = n)  # X values between 5 and 6
Y_narrow <- 2 * X_narrow + rnorm(n, mean = 0, sd = 1)  # Y = 2X + noise

# Case 2: Wide spread of X
X_wide <- seq(1, 10, length.out = n)  # X values between 1 and 10
Y_wide <- 2 * X_wide + rnorm(n, mean = 0, sd = 1)  # Y = 2X + noise

# Fit regression models
model_narrow <- lm(Y_narrow ~ X_narrow)
model_wide <- lm(Y_wide ~ X_wide)

# Extract standard errors of the slope
se_slope_narrow <- summary(model_narrow)$coefficients[2, 2]
se_slope_wide <- summary(model_wide)$coefficients[2, 2]

# Print results
cat("Standard Error of Slope (Narrow Spread):", se_slope_narrow, "\n")
cat("Standard Error of Slope (Wide Spread):", se_slope_wide, "\n")

# Plot the data and regression lines
par(mfrow = c(1, 2))  # Set up side-by-side plots

# Narrow Spread
plot(X_narrow, Y_narrow, main = "Narrow Spread of X", xlab = "X", ylab = "Y", pch = 16, col = "blue")
abline(model_narrow, col = "red", lwd = 2)

# Wide Spread
plot(X_wide, Y_wide, main = "Wide Spread of X", xlab = "X", ylab = "Y", pch = 16, col = "blue")
abline(model_wide, col = "red", lwd = 2)

# Reset plot layout
par(mfrow = c(1, 1))

```
